0.name: Odin
0.description: Watch your head. This rocket-mounted firework explodes at a maximum height of 300 feet, bursting in iridescent huges of teal, purple and orange. Recommended use over a large body of water.

1.name: Ifrit
1.description: A dragon's tongue is forked; so is Ifrit's. This display reproduces plumes of fire from a dragon's molten lungs in dual displays of red and orange pyrotechnics. Explodes at a maximum height of 200 feet.

2.name: Shiva
2.description: Shiva's icy veins explode in this cascading, willow-like firework that lingers in the sky for up to 30 seconds after detonation.

3.name: Neo Bahamut
3.description: A bigger version of its sibling, Bahamut, Neo Bahamut renders a single yellow spire after detonation. As the ordnance falls, it increases in vibrance, illuminating the sky. Do not use with other ordnances.

4.name: Knights of the Round
4.description: Consider the roman candle as a cannon. Knights fires successive ordnances up to 400 feet, each exploding in six distinct pyrotechnic patterns.
